sentence.Network_en: Investment could dry up and that could cause the economy to falter.
sentence.Network_cn: 投资可能会中断，而这会引起经济衰退。

sentence.Network_en: There were few dry eyes in the house when I finished.
sentence.Network_cn: 我说完后房间里没几个人不掉泪的。

sentence.Network_en: Dry hair can be damaged by washing it too frequently.
sentence.Network_cn: 干性头发洗得太频繁容易受损。

lj.lj_ls: 到目前为止，实验仍未成功。

jx.jx_en_mean: (with reference to a play, film, or similar event) everyone in the audience was moved to tears
jx.jx_cn_mean: （观看戏剧、电影等）观众没有不掉眼泪的

lj.lj_ly: he intends to dry out and get his life back together again.
lj.lj_ls: 他想要戒酒，并再次恢复有条有理的生活。

jx.jx_en_mean: To undergo a cure for alcoholism.
To make or become unproductive, especially to do so gradually.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使…失去生产力，尤指逐渐地

means.word_mean: 干旱的
其他释义
干的;干燥的;干旱的
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dry̅ge (adjective), dry̅ge (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Middle Low German dröge, Dutch droog, and German trocken

encyclopedia.content: 英语单词 英音：[drai]美音：[dra?] 1、形容词 a. 1. 干的；干燥的 The paint is not yet dry. 油漆还未干。 2. 干旱的 That state has a dry climate in winter. 该州冬天气候干燥。 3. （使）口渴的 4. （面包等）不涂奶油（果酱）的[B] He managed to swallow a little soup and dry toast. 他设法吞下一点汤和不涂奶油的土司。 5. 无泪的 6. （酒等）不甜的，无果味的 She asked for a dry martini. 她要了一杯干马提尼酒。 7

entry.def: If something is dry, there is no water or moisture on it or in it.

example.ex: Clean the metal with a soft dry cloth...
example.tran: 用柔软的干布擦拭金属。

example.ex: Pat it dry with a soft towel...
example.tran: 用柔软的毛巾将它拍干。

entry.def: When something dries or when you dry it, it becomes dry.

example.ex: The washing might dry outside today, the sun's shining...
example.tran: 洗过的衣物可能今天晾在外面就能干,阳光正足。

example.ex: Leave your hair to dry naturally whenever possible...
example.tran: 尽可能让头发自然晾干。

entry.def: When you dry the dishes after a meal, you wipe the water off the plates, cups, knives, pans, and other things when they have been washed, using a cloth.

example.ex: Mrs. Madrigal began drying dishes.
example.tran: 马德里加尔夫人开始擦干碟子。

entry.tran: (皮肤或头发)发干的,无水分的
entry.def: If you say that your skin or hair is dry, you mean that it is less oily than, or not as soft as, normal.

example.ex: Nothing looks worse than dry, cracked lips...
example.tran: 没有什么比干燥开裂的嘴唇更难看的了。

example.ex: Dry hair can be damaged by washing it too frequently...
example.tran: 干性头发洗得太频繁容易受损。

entry.tran: 干旱的;雨量少的;无雨的
entry.def: If the weather or a period of time is dry, there is no rain or there is much less rain than average.

example.ex: Exceptionally dry weather over the past year had cut agricultural production...
example.tran: 去年罕见的干旱天气已导致农业减产。

example.ex: The spring had been unusually dry and we received only two tenths of an inch of rain during the entire month of June.
example.tran: 春天异常干旱，我们在整个 6 月只有 0.2 英寸的降雨量。

entry.def: A dry place or climate is one that gets very little rainfall.

example.ex: It was one of the driest and dustiest places in Africa.
example.tran: 那是非洲最干旱、尘土最多的地方之一。

example.ex: ...a hot, dry climate where the sun is shining all the time.
example.tran: 终年阳光明媚的炎热干旱气候

entry.def: In the dry means in a place or at a time that is not damp, wet, or rainy.

example.ex: Such cars, however, do grip the road well, even in the dry.
example.tran: 不过，这种车即使在干燥路面上也表现出了良好的抓地性能。

entry.tran: (通常指河流、湖泊或水井由于天热少雨而)干涸的
entry.def: If a river, lake, or well is dry, it is empty of water, usually because of hot weather and lack of rain.

example.ex: The aquifer which had once fed the wells was pronounced dry...
example.tran: 曾为水井供水的蓄水层正式宣告干涸了。

example.ex: The single-engine plane landed at a dry lake in western Arizona...
example.tran: 单引擎飞机在亚利桑那州西部的一个干涸的湖底着陆了。

entry.def: If an oil well is dry, it is no longer producing any oil.

example.ex: To harvest oil and gas profitably from the North Sea, it must focus on the exploitation of small reserves as the big wells run dry.
example.tran: 随着大型油井的枯竭，要想从北海的石油和天然气开采中盈利,必须着力于开采小储量的油井。

entry.def: If you are dry, you need to drink something.

example.ex: She was suddenly thirsty and dry.
example.tran: 她突然口渴了。

entry.tran: (因紧张、生病等)口干的,喉咙干的
entry.def: If your mouth or throat is dry, it has little or no saliva in it, and so feels very unpleasant, perhaps because you are tense or ill.

example.ex: His mouth was dry, he needed a drink...
example.tran: 他口很干,需要喝上一杯。

example.ex: My throat was dry. I was at a loss for words.
example.tran: 我喉咙很干,不知说什么才好。

entry.def: A dry cough is one that does not produce any mucus.
If someone has dry eyes, there are no tears in their eyes; often used with negatives or in contexts where you are expressing surprise that they are not crying.

example.ex: There were few dry eyes in the house when I finished...
example.tran: 我说完后房间里没几个人不掉泪的。

example.ex: She didn't wince and her eyes were dry. Talk about brave. She was unbelievable.
example.tran: 她连眉头也未皱一下,也没哭。说到勇敢,她令人难以置信。

entry.def: If a country, state, or city is dry, it has laws or rules which forbid anyone to drink, sell, or buy alcoholic drink.

example.ex: Gujurat has been a totally dry state for the past thirty years.
example.tran: 在过去的 30 年里古吉拉特一直是完全禁酒的一个州。

entry.def: If you say that someone is sucking something dry or milking it dry, you are criticizing them for taking all the good things from it until there is nothing left.

example.ex: ...a shady rip-off industry that sucks its talent dry then discards it...
example.tran: 见不得人的山寨行业吸干了它的才华后又将它抛弃

example.ex: He's just milking the company dry.
example.tran: 他是要把公司榨干。

entry.tran: (幽默)不露声色的,含蓄不露的,机敏的
entry.def: Dry humour is very amusing, but in a subtle and clever way.

example.ex: Fulton has retained his dry humour...
example.tran: 富尔顿保持着他含而不露的幽默。

example.ex: Mr Brooke is renowned for his dry wit.
example.tran: 布鲁克先生因他不露声色的机智而闻名。

entry.tran: 冷淡的;淡然的;不动感情的;冷冰冰的
entry.def: If you describe a voice as dry, you mean that it is cold or dull, and does not express any emotions.

example.ex: When he crept back to his desk, he heard the dry voice of Father Laurence.
example.tran: 当他轻手轻脚地回到读经台时,他听到了劳伦斯神父冷冰冰的声音。

entry.tran: 枯燥乏味的;干巴巴的;无趣的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a book, play, or activity as dry, you mean that it is dull and uninteresting.

example.ex: ...dry, academic phrases.
example.tran: 枯燥无味的学术词汇

example.ex: A lot of the work was very dry and boring in Westminster.
example.tran: 威斯敏斯特的许多工作非常枯燥无味令人厌烦。

entry.tran: (面包或吐司)不涂黄油和果酱的
entry.def: Dry bread or toast is plain and not covered with butter or jam.

example.ex: For breakfast, they had dry bread and tea.
example.tran: 他们早餐吃了无黄油的面包，还喝了茶。

entry.def: Dry sherry or wine does not have a sweet taste.

example.ex: ...a glass of chilled, dry white wine.
example.tran: 一杯冰镇干白葡萄酒

entry.def: If a river, lake, or well dries up, it becomes empty of water, usually because of hot weather and a lack of rain.

example.ex: Reservoirs are drying up and farmers have begun to leave their land...
example.tran: 水库逐渐干涸,农民开始背井离乡。

example.ex: The fountain is reputed never to dry up.
example.tran: 这口泉号称从不干涸。

entry.def: If a supply of something dries up, it stops.

example.ex: Investment could dry up and that could cause the economy to falter...
example.tran: 投资可能会中断,而这会引起经济衰退。

example.ex: Credit from foreign banks is drying up...
example.tran: 外资银行的放贷金额持续萎缩，面临枯竭。

entry.def: If you dry up when you are speaking, you stop in the middle of what you were saying, because you cannot think what to say next.

example.ex: If you ask her what she's good at she will dry up after two minutes.
example.tran: 如果你问她擅长什么，两分钟后她就没话说了。

means.word_mean: 1. a reformer who opposes the use of intoxicating beverages
1. remove the moisture from and make dry;
2. become dry or drier;
1. free from liquid or moisture; lacking natural or normal moisture or depleted of water; or no longer wet;
2. humorously sarcastic or mocking;

sentences.sentence: "an ironic remark often conveys an intended meaning obliquely"

means.word_mean: 3. opposed to or prohibiting the production and sale of alcoholic beverages;

sentences.sentence: "the dry vote led by preachers and bootleggers"

means.word_mean: 4. not producing milk;
5. (of wines) not sweet because of decomposition of sugar during fermentation;
6. without a mucous or watery discharge;

sentences.sentence: "that rare thing in the wintertime; a small child with a dry nose"

means.word_mean: 7. not shedding tears;
8. lacking interest or stimulation; dull and lifeless;

sentences.sentence: "a dry lecture filled with trivial details"
"dull and juiceless as only book knowledge can be when it is unrelated to...life"- John Mason Brown

means.word_mean: 9. used of solid substances in contrast with liquid ones;
10. unproductive especially of the expected results;
11. having no adornment or coloration;

sentences.sentence: "rattled off the facts in a dry mechanical manner"

means.word_mean: 12. (of food) eaten without a spread or sauce or other garnish;
13. suffering from fluid deprivation;
14. having a large proportion of strong liquor;

sentences.sentence: "a very dry martini is almost straight gin"

means.word_mean: 15. lacking warmth or emotional involvement;
16. practicing complete abstinence from alcoholic beverages;

sentences.sentence: "no thank you; I happen to be teetotal"

list.explanation: 禁止销售含酒精饮料的，禁酒的

example.en: Some small towns are dry，but not many.
example.zh: 现在有些小城市是禁酒的，但是这么做的城镇不多。

list.explanation: 饮酒有节制的，不再酗酒的

example.zh: 听说特蕾西不再酗酒了。

example.en: My throat is dry after that hike.
example.zh: 长途步行 后，我口渴得很。

list.explanation: (处于)被抛弃的、孤立无援的、困苦的(状态或境地)

example.en: Here I sit high and dry—no food, no money, no nothing.
example.zh: 在这儿我孤立无援——没有食物，没有钱，一无所有。

example.en: The old man was left high and dry.

auth_sentence.res_content: Drain, refresh in iced water and pat dry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Drain, refresh in iced water and pat dry.

auth_sentence.content: Mouth breathing causes a dry mouth and cracked lips.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mouth breathing causes a dry mouth and cracked lips.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mouth breathing causes a dry mouth and cracked lips.

stems_affixes.word_buile: dry干→adj.干的,口渴的 v.[使]干燥,[使]变干
dry干+ain表名词→使……干了→流干→耗尽→排水沟
dry过去分词形式→drought干旱, 缺乏
dry干+ain表名词→使……干了→流干→耗尽→排水沟
dry干→adj.干的,口渴的 v.[使]干燥,[使]变干

Sentence.sentence: That part of Brazil is very dry and farming is often difficult there.
Physical symptoms listed include dry eyes, backaches, skipping meals, poor personal hygiene (卫生) and sleep disturbances.
The dry statistics ought to inform the ongoing deficit debate, because a budget is not just a catalog of programs and taxes.

means.word_mean: 变干, 把…弄干

sentences.en: We were drying our clothes by squeezing.

jushi.chinese: 南澳大利亚是干旱气候。

jushi.english: When I read the novel I skipped these dry passages of description.
jushi.chinese: 我读这本小说的时候,就跳过了这几段毫无趣味的描写。

jushi.english: They walked along a dry riverbed.
jushi.chinese: 他们沿着干涸的河床走。
